Tigres : Gignac et son √©quipe s'√©loigne du titre !
Les Tigres de Andr√© Pierre Gignac n'ont pas r√©ussi √† faire mieux que 0-0 face √† Quer√©taro et ils n'ont plus que deux matchs pour rattraper 5 points face au leader Santos Laguna.
03 Nov 2019, 08:20 by Hugo Deloraine



Olympique de MarseilleEn 2004, l'Olympique de Marseille se hisse en finale de la Coupe de l'UEFA, apr√®s avoir √©t√© revers√© dans cette comp√©tition suite √† la 3e place obtenue en Ligue des Champions. Les Olympiens se hissent jusqu'en finale face √† Valence gr√¢ce √† un grand Didier Drogba, d√©j√† √©tincelant tout au long de la saison. Mais les hommes de Jos√© Anigo ne pourront battre Valence, d√©faits 2-0 par les Espagnols. Ce match sera notamment marqu√© par le carton rouge re√ßu par Fabien Barthez peu avant la mi-temps.Icon Sport



Olympique LyonnaisL'OL se hisse trois fois de suite en Quart de finale de la Ligue des Champions de 2004 et 2006, ce qui est remarquable. D'abord sous la houlette de Paul Le Guen en 2004, puis de G√©rard Houiller par la suite, les Gones dominaient le paysage europ√©en des clubs fran√ßais. Port√© par ses joueurs embl√©matiques tels que Cris, Juninho ou encore Coupet, l'OL a r√©alis√© de nombreuses √©pop√©es europ√©ennes au d√©but du 21e si√®cle.Icon Sport

Apr√®s avoir √©liminer Chelsea et le Real Madrid, les co√©quipiers de Morientes, qui finit d'ailleurs meilleur buteur de la comp√©tition, se retrouveront en finale de la Coupe. Malheureusement, ils s'inclineront face √† une sublime √©quipe de Porto emmen√©e par Jos√© Mourinho.Icon Sport



Girondins de BordeauxEn 1996, les Girondins de Bordeaux se hissent en finale de la Coupe de l'UEFA. Malheureusement, les co√©quipiers de Zidane et Dugarry, notamment, s'inclineront en finale face au Bayern (5-1, score cumul√©).Icon Sport



Paris Saint-GermainEn 1996, le PSG remporte la Coupe d'Europe des vainqueurs de coupe en venant √† bout du Rapid Vienne en finale (1-0). Paul Le Guen, Daniel Bravo ou encore Youri Djorkaeff constituaient l'√©quipe parisienne.Icon Sport

Jacques Chirac : qu'ont fait les clubs fran√ßais lors de ses deux mandats ?

text:
Mexico
Tigres: Gignac and his team move away from the title!
The Tigers of Andr√© Pierre Gignac have not managed to do better than 0-0 against Quer√©taro and they have more than two games to catch 5 points against leader Santos Laguna.
03 Nov 2019, 08:20 by Hugo Deloraine



Olympique de MarseilleIn 2004, Olympique de Marseille advanced to the UEFA Cup final, having been donated to this competition after finishing third in the Champions League. The Olympians climb to the final against Valencia thanks to a great Didier Drogba, already sparkling throughout the season. But the men of Jose Anigo will not be able to beat Valencia, defeated 2-0 by the Spaniards. This match will be particularly marked by the red card received by Fabien Barthez shortly before half-time.Icon Sport



Olympique LyonnaisL'OL has risen three times in the quarter-finals of the Champions League in 2004 and 2006, which is remarkable. First under the leadership of Paul Le Guen in 2004, then G√©rard Houiller thereafter, the Gones dominated the European landscape of French clubs. Worn by its iconic players such as Cris, Juninho or Coupet, the OL has made many European epics in the early 21st century.Icon Sport



AS Monaco In 2004, AS Monaco, led by Didier Deschamps, achieved an exceptional European course. After eliminating Chelsea and Real Madrid, Morientes' team-mates, who finished as top scorer in the competition, will be in the Cup final. Unfortunately, they will bow to a sublime Porto team led by Jos√© Mourinho.Icon Sport



Girondins de BordeauxIn 1996, the Girondins de Bordeaux advanced to the UEFA Cup final. Unfortunately, the teammates of Zidane and Dugarry, in particular, will bow to the final against Bayern (5-1, cumulative score).



Paris Saint-GermainIn 1996, PSG won the European Cup Winners' Cup by defeating Rapid Wien in the final (1-0). Paul Le Guen, Daniel Bravo and Yuri Djorkaeff were the Parisian team.Icon Sport

Jacques Chirac: what did the French clubs do during his two terms?




Five points. This is what separates the Tigers of Andr√© Pierre Gignac from the leader Santos Laguna, two days before the end of the Mexican championship. Hard to imagine "APG" lift the opening Tournament Cup under these conditions. Indeed, the Tigers failed to win against the club Quer√©taro and left with the point of the draw (0-0)




Gignac takes a walkabout




"APG" +5 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

For their part, Santos Laguna won against Club Am√©rica (2-1) and sees their chances of title approaching. Andr√© Pierre Gignac, he consoled himself by performing a bath of crowds after the meeting.
